title: Senior Frontend Developer
details: Bluestream Health was acquired by eVisit in April 2023, and I've been working to transition and to continue to maintain and expand upon the products we developed as small team
Expanded modular front door to double the number of possible use cases
Supported the development of our app to work in legacy browsers embedded on hospital TVs

title: Senior Frontend Developer
details: Maintained and greatly expanded upon the frontend of the WebRTC healthcare web app I created and designed previously as a contractor

Sole frontend developer for 5 years of my tenure, I was an integral part of the creation and implementation of new features particularly on the WebRTC video layer, while maintaining compatibility across many different browsers, platforms, and devices
Architected migration of video layer from AngularJS to React.js/TypeScript, with a focus on being highly configurable and easily extensible for the entire dev team
Developed the frontend for a module-based configurable patient front door allowing us to easily address the needs of any new and existing customer needs

title: Frontend Developer
details: Quickly picked up React.js and focused on improving code and design quality across multiple apps
Enhanced graphing dashboard and reduced load times and technical debt while adding new features

title: Frontend Developer / Designer
details: Architected the frontend of the MVP web-based peer-to-peer healthcare communication using WebRTC and AngularJS
Designed and implemented the UI/UX of the app using Sass and Bootstrap with limited design assets

title: Frontend Web Developer
details: Developed multiple cloud-based tools for established education start-up using Agile/SCRUM and Kanban processes with a distributed development team
Created a custom style framework for Scholar, a note-taking tool, focusing primarily on UX and modularity
Implemented redesign of EasyBib.com using Less.js, while restructuring legacy code focusing on clarity and extensibility
Independently built new citation tool for ResearchReady.com from the ground up using Chaplin and CoffeeScript
Collaborated with the marketing team to build a customizable WordPress site for press releases

title: Web Developer
details: Constructed complex WordPress "magazine"-style site with a variety of posts types and linked content
Improved upon and expanded rough design outline, created the responsive mobile layout

title: Web Developer
details: Supported a team of four designers, focusing on multiple time-sensitive projects simultaneously
Transformed Photoshop designs into fully functional websites
Converted many Flash-based experiences into HTML5 while maintaining support for older browsers, mainly IE 6
Translated elaborate designs into websites for a variety of industries, including fashion, education and retail
Completed an estimated four new high quality websites per month, while working under strict deadlines
